original_solution_mapping.L2: 18 mph slower than 60 mph is 60-18=<<60-18=42>>42 mph.
original_solution_mapping.L3: If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages (60+72+42)/3 = <<(60+72+42)/3=58>>58 mph.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 175.
    Returns: the average speed of the dune buggy in miles per hour.
    """
    # L1
    flat_sand_speed = 60 # speed of 60 miles per hour
    downhill_speed_increase = 12 # 12 miles per hour faster
    downhill_speed = flat_sand_speed + downhill_speed_increase

    # L2
    uphill_speed_decrease = 18 # 18 miles per hour slower
    uphill_speed = flat_sand_speed - uphill_speed_decrease

    # L3
    time_fraction_denominator = 3 # one-third of the time
    average_speed = (flat_sand_speed + downhill_speed + uphill_speed) / time_fraction_denominator

    # FA
    answer = average_speed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: {uphill_speed_decrease} mph slower than {flat_sand_speed} mph is {flat_sand_speed}-{uphill_speed_decrease}=<<{flat_sand_speed}-{uphill_speed_decrease}={uphill_speed}>>{uphill_speed} mph.

If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages ({flat_sand_speed}+{downhill_speed}+{uphill_speed})/{time_fraction_denominator} = <<({flat_sand_speed}+{downhill_speed}+{uphill_speed})/{time_fraction_denominator}={average_speed}>>{average_speed} mph.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 18 mph slower than 60 mph is 60-18=<<60-18=42>>42 mph.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages (12+72+42)/3 = <<(12+72+42)/3=42>>42 mph.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'downhill_speed_increase' (12) was used instead of 'flat_sand_speed' (60).
